start.text:
TEST 1 AUTHORIZED
ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAINMENT TRIAL
Objective: Establish baseline environmental tolerances.

start.narrate: (The monitor sits dark and inert. Its glass reflects only vague shapes.)

start.text: So this is the first test, the first assignment.
Yes. You will be working with Artifact CAC-B04-312.
First test, performed by 'Archivist <username>', on Artifact CAC-B04-312.

start.narrate: A soft mechanical click. The overhead lights brighten by a fraction.

start.text: Our system detects everything at all times. Lighting conditions just matter now.
You earn protocol fragments. Make your choice, Archivist.

start.narrate: You glance at the switch panel.

options.text: A) Leave the lighting at its current level
B) Turn on the overhead lights

good_1.narrate: Nothing happens. Which somehow feels intentional.
The CRT's screen remains dark. The room hums softly.

good_1.text: Sometimes making the right choice is not doing anything. Remember well.

ARCHIVAL FRAGMENT VERIFIED.
UNREDACTED:
"House the unit in a dimly lit media containment room."
Or it prefers not being stared at. Same survival instinct, different angle.

good_1.narrate: The lights subtly dim further, as if the room itself agrees.

bad_1.narrate: You push the button with the light.
You see the monitor start to shake. You hear loud screeching from inside the containment room.

bad_1.text: Sometimes making the right choice is not doing anything. Remember well.
Head on out, we have to clean out the area first.

bad_1.narrate: You don't recall reaching the exit before everything goes dark.

segment_2_intro.narrate: A faint line of warm light cuts across the floor.

segment_2_intro.text: Yes. That's the external shutter drifting.

segment_2_intro.narrate: You look toward a reinforced window. The shutter is slowly opening.

segment_2_intro.text: Environmental variable detected: external light source.

options.text: B) Allow sunlight to enter the room

good_2.narrate: The warm light vanishes. The room returns to its muted gray tone.
For a moment, the glass of the monitor looks less reflective. Less... present.

good_2.text:
ARCHIVAL FRAGMENT VERIFIED.
UNREDACTED:
"No direct sunlight."
You've squinted when there's bright light, have you not?
I'm saying whatever's in there has learned that lesson already.

good_2.narrate: She doesn't look at you as she says this.

bad_2.narrate: The shutter continues to open. You feel a greater sense of unease as sunlight slowly creeps toward the table.
The light crawls up the table and slowly, surely reaches the artifact.
(You see something pressing against the computer screen.)

bad_2.text: Does this place seem bright to you?
Head on out, we have to clean out the area first.

bad_2.narrate: You don't recall reaching the exit before everything goes dark.

segment_3_intro.narrate: A low hum begins to build. One of the wall-mounted speakers powers on.

segment_3_intro.text: Audio equipment detected within containment space.
Nope. Site auto-check. Happens every cycle. Continue your work, make your choice.

segment_3_intro.narrate: The speaker emits a faint test tone.
The monitor lets out a quiet tick.

options.text: A) Disable all external audio equipment
B) Allow ambient audio to continue

good_3.narrate: The test tone cuts off abruptly.
The room feels... flatter. Like pressure equalizing.

good_3.text:
ARCHIVAL FRAGMENT VERIFIED.
UNREDACTED:
"No active audio equipment beyond the monitor."
Ever notice how silence feels louder when something expects sound?
I don't like the way you phrased that.
Good. Means you're paying attention. Keep your guard up around here, it's not as safe as you think.

bad_3.narrate: You allow the speakers to continue.
The CRT screeches. You see orange tendrils press against the screen.
You can feel its attempts to block out all the sound.

bad_3.text: Have you ever tried putting a microphone next to a speaker?
Yeah, I have. I never liked the sound of it.
Head on out, we have to clean out the area first.

bad_3.narrate: You don't recall reaching the exit before everything goes dark.

segment_4_intro.narrate: (A power console lights up beside the table.)

segment_4_intro.text: So if I am thinking correctly, it wouldn't like outages.
'Doesn't like' is generous. Think more... panic response.
You wouldn't like it if I unplugged your life support, would you?

options.text: A) Route power through uninterrupted supply

good_4.narrate: (The console emits a soft confirmation chime.)
(The CRT emits a faint warmth. Not enough to be alarming.)

good_4.text:
ARCHIVAL FRAGMENT VERIFIED.
UNREDACTED:
"Maintain continuous power."
Yeah. Warmth is the sign of life.

bad_4.narrate: (You switch power to be directed from the manual breaker.)

bad_4.text: Power supply redirected, power source: manual breaker.

bad_4.narrate: (A large spark erupts from the back of the computer.)

bad_4.text: I think I made a mistake. Is it going to fry?
It'll be fine, after a while.
Head on out, we have to clean out the area first.

bad_4.narrate: (You don't recall reaching the exit before everything goes dark.)

segment_5_intro.text: We pretend to cut power. Emphasis on pretend.

options.text: B) Allow outage to exceed 30 seconds

good_5.text: On not teaching it a new bad habit.

bad_5.text:
ARCHIVAL FRAGMENT VERIFIED.
UNREDACTED:
"Power loss beyond 30 seconds triggers aggressive activity."

bad_5.narrate: (A quiet breath escapes you - you don't remember holding it.)

bad_5.text: Test 1 is done. Keep this up and you'll keep your job and life.

success_end.text:
TEST 1 COMPLETE
ARCHIVE CLEARANCE UPDATED
CURRENT CLEARANCE: 25%

success_end.narrate: (As you turn to leave, you catch a reflection in the glass.)
(You swear you can hear something rumbling softly.)

success_end.text: We're going to head on to the next test. We can stop pretending it's just an object.
There are consequences to the mistakes you make. Something will notice them.

call.name: passSequence
call.text: Test 1 marked PASS. Returning to terminal...
